chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Jerome Thein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.198(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court recommends Mr. Thein placed in the probation Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety. 
Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
NO CONTACT with victims K.B. and S.B.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 
If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Restitution set at $0.00.

timeConds.notes: To be used at the department's discretion, with Huber release for work and treatment.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Jerome Thein

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional Statements by: Stephen Peters. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 0 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to 22CM1428; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS ELIGIBLE the WI Substance Abuse program.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 6 MONTHS condition time STAYED and to be used at the department's discretion, with Huber release for work and treatment.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- NO CONTACT with victims K.B. and S.B. 
- Restitution set at $0.00.

*Court recommends Mr. Thein placed in the probation Mental Health Unit. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Donald Jerome Thein.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Donald Jerome Thein.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant has a pending case in DV court. Parties are pursuing a global resolution. Court will accept defendants other case for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Donald Jerome Thein not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case in Branch 29. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 29 if Judge Kiefer is willing to accept jurisdiction. Case adjourned for status conference, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Donald Jerome Thein not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a scheduling conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Defendant Donald Jerome Thein in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Kathy A. B.
No Contact Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Donald Jerome Thein in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donald Jerome Thein appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
